metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0795 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibreOffice before 5.0.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted LwpTocSuperLayout record in a LotusWordPro (lwp) document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

browser-plugin-libreoffice - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu4
libreoffice - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu4
libreoffice-avmedia-backend-gstreamer - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu4
